revision.text:
{{pp-semi-blp|small=yes}} {{Infobox comedian | name = Tig Notaro | image = Tig Notaro by Gage Skidmore.jpg | caption = Tig Notaro at the 2018 [[San Diego Comic-Con International]] | alt = Tig Notaro at Bumbershoot 2010 | birth_name = Mathilde O'Callaghan Notaro | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1971|3|24|mf=yes}} | birth_place = [[Jackson, Mississippi]], U.S. | medium = [[Stand-up comedy|Stand-up]] | active = 2001–present | spouse = {{marriage|[[Stephanie Allynne]]|2015}} | children = 2 | genre = [[Observational comedy]] | website = {{URL|http://tignation.com}} }} '''Mathilde "Tig" O'Callaghan Notaro''' (born March 24, 1971)<ref name=FamilySearch-USPR-2004>{{cite web|title=Mathilde O. Notaro - United States Public Records|url=https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:QJ44-DSCP|website=[[FamilySearch]]|accessdate=December 1, 2014}}</ref> is an American [[Stand-up comedy|stand-up comic]], writer, radio contributor, and actress.<ref name=LarryKingNow-Interview-2014>{{cite news|last1=King|first1=Larry|title=Tig Notaro|url=http://www.ora.tv/larrykingnow/tig-notaro-0_5ew4mpv6adae|accessdate=December 1, 2014|work=[[Larry King Now]]|date=September 29, 2014|format=Video interview}}</ref> She is known for her [[deadpan]] comedy.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.newyorker.com/culture/cultural-comment/tig-notaros-topless-set|title=Tig Notaro's Topless Set|last=Marantz|first=Andrew|work=[[The New Yorker]]|date=7 November 2014}}</ref> Her acclaimed album ''[[Live (Tig Notaro album)|Live]]'' was nominated in 2014 for the [[Grammy Award for Best Comedy Album]] at the [[56th Annual Grammy Awards]]. The special ''[[Tig Notaro: Boyish Girl Interrupted]]'' was nominated in 2016 at the [[68th Primetime Emmy Awards]] for [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Writing for a Variety Special|Outstanding Writing for a Variety Special]]. In 2017, the album of ''Boyish Girl Interrupted'' was nominated for the Grammy Award for Best Comedy Album at the [[59th Annual Grammy Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Tig Notaro Awards|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0449299/awards?ref_=nm_awd|website=[[IMDb]].com|accessdate=May 15, 2018}}</ref>
==Early life== Notaro was born in [[Jackson, Mississippi]]. Her mother was born in New Orleans.<ref name=NOLA-BoyishGirl-2014/> Notaro was raised in [[Pass Christian, Mississippi]], until kindergarten. Her family later moved to [[Spring, Texas]], a suburb of [[Houston, Texas|Houston]].<ref name=MotherJones-Interview-2013>{{cite news|last1=Brownstone|first1=Sydney|title=Tig Notaro: You'll Laugh, You'll Cry |url=https://www.motherjones.com/media/2013/04/interview-tig-notaro-cancer-professor-blastoff-inside-amy-schumer|accessdate=December 1, 2014|work=[[Mother Jones Magazine|Mother Jones]]|issue=May/June 2013}}</ref><ref name=BuzzFeed-Year-2013>{{cite news|last1=Allen|first1=Sandra|title=Tig Notaro And The Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad, Yet Somehow Completely Amazing Year|url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/sandraeallen/tig-notaro-and-the-terrible-horrible-no-good-very-bad-yet-so|accessdate=December 1, 2014|work=[[BuzzFeed]]|date=August 9, 2013}}</ref> She has a brother, Renaud Notaro, who is a year older than she and is a radio talk show host.<ref name=LarryKingNow-Interview-2014/><ref name=Earwolf-Renaud>{{cite web|title=Person: Renaud Notaro|url=http://www.earwolf.com/person/renaud-notaro|website=[[Earwolf]]|accessdate=December 1, 2014}}</ref>
Notaro's great-great-grandfather was [[John Fitzpatrick (New Orleans)|John Fitzpatrick]], mayor of [[New Orleans]] from 1892 to 1896.<ref name=NOLA-BoyishGirl-2014>{{cite news|last1=Root|first1=Cate|title=Tig Notaro brings 'Boyish Girl Interrupted' tour to New Orleans Oct. 12|url=http://www.nola.com/arts/index.ssf/2014/10/tig_notaro_new_orleans.html|accessdate=December 1, 2014|work=[[The Times-Picayune]]|date=October 7, 2014}}</ref><ref name="GambitWeekly-Interview-2011">{{cite news|first=Will|last=Coviello|url=http://www.bestofneworleans.com/gambit/big-name-talent/Content?oid=1495833|title=Interview: Tig Notaro|work=The Gambit Weekly|date=January 3, 2011|accessdate=May 14, 2012}}</ref>
Notaro said she hated school. She failed three grades, eventually dropping out of high school. In 1990, while living in Texas, Notaro got her [[General Equivalency Diploma|GED]].<ref name=MotherJones-Interview-2013/><ref name=Netflix-Tig-2015>{{cite web|last1=Goolsby|first1=Kristina|last2=York|first2=Ashley|title=Tig|url=https://www.netflix.com/title/80028208|website=[[Netflix]]|accessdate=17 July 2015|date=17 July 2015}}</ref>
==Career== [[File:Tig Notaro 2010.jpg|upright|right|thumb|Tig Notaro in 2010]] Notaro moved to [[Denver, Colorado]], where she became involved in the music industry. She became a band manager, working under the name Tignation Promotions in the mid-'90s.<ref name=Magnet-DontRush-2011>{{cite news|last1=Rapa|first1=Patrick|date=September 14, 2011|url=http://www.magnetmagazine.com/2011/09/14/tig-notaro-dont-rush-me|title=Tig Notaro: Don't Rush Me|work=[[Magnet (magazine)|Magnet]]|accessdate=October 14, 2012}}</ref>
Notaro's work promoting bands took her to Los Angeles, where she tried stand-up for the first time in the late '90s.<ref name=MotherJones-Interview-2013/><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/culture/2013/01/tig-notaro-breast-cancer-dont-connect-with-jokes|title=Tig Notaro on How Surviving Cancer Changes Humor: "I Don't Connect With Some of My Jokes Anymore"|last=Grigoriadis|first=Vanessa|work=Vanity Fair|access-date=2017-12-28|language=en}}</ref> Notaro has since been featured on ''[[Comedy Central Presents]]'' and on ''[[The Sarah Silverman Program]]'' as a lesbian police officer. She collaborates frequently with writing partner [[Kyle Dunnigan]]. With Dunnigan and [[David Huntsberger]], she co-hosted the podcast ''[[Professor Blastoff]]'' from May 2011 until July 2015.
In 2011, she released her debut stand-up album, ''[[Good One]]''. Her 2012 sophomore album, ''[[Live (Tig Notaro album)|Live]]'', is a recording of a stand-up set performed shortly after she was diagnosed with breast cancer.
In 2012, Notaro appeared on the ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'' television show, and in May of that year on the live episode of ''[[This American Life]]'', which was broadcast to theaters nationwide and on radio in edited form. She performed a monologue about having encountered [[Taylor Dayne]] on multiple occasions, greeting her each time with, "Excuse me, I'm sorry to bother you, but I just have to tell you. I love your voice." After her monologue, Dayne made a surprise appearance, serenading Notaro with the song "I'll Always Love You".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thisamericanlife.org/blog/2012/05/live-show-redux |title=Live Show Redux |publisher=This American Life |date=2012-05-18 |accessdate=2012-05-22}}</ref> She worked on fellow comedian [[Amy Schumer]]'s [[Comedy Central]] series ''[[Inside Amy Schumer]].'' Also in 2012, Notaro did a [[Kickstarter]]-funded series called ''Clown Service'' written by and starring Notaro.<ref name=Kickstarter-ClownService-2014>{{cite web|title=Clown Service|url=https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/tignotaro/clown-service|website=[[Kickstarter]]|accessdate=22 August 2015}}</ref>
Notaro wrote a memoir for [[HarperCollins]] imprint [[Ecco Press|Ecco]] called ''I'm Just a Person'',<ref name=Guardian-TragedyGold-2012>{{cite news|last1=Holland|first1=Jessica|title=How Tig Notaro turned tragedy into comic gold|url=https://www.theguardian.com/culture/2012/oct/21/tig-notaro-interview-cancer-standup|accessdate=February 23, 2015|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=October 20, 2012}}</ref> and there is a [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] documentary<ref name=HRerporter-ShowDoc-2013>{{cite news|last1=Goldberg|first1=Lesley|title=Showtime Sets Tig Notaro Documentary|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/showtime-sets-tig-notaro-documentary-578643|accessdate=December 1, 2014|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=July 2, 2013}}</ref> made about her life that chronicled her post-cancer stand-up tour<ref name=LarryKingNow-Interview-2014/> called ''[[Knock Knock, It's Tig Notaro]].''<ref name=Showtime-KnockKnock-2015>{{cite web|title=Knock Knock, It's Tig Notaro|url=http://www.sho.com/sho/comedy/titles/3401415/knock-knock-its-tig-notaro#/index|website=[[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]]|accessdate=17 July 2015}}</ref>
In July 2015, a [[Netflix]] movie called ''[[Tig (film)|Tig]]'',<ref name=NPR-AllThingConsidered-TigNetflix-2015>{{cite news|last1=Hajek|first1=Daniel|title=Amid Devastation, Tig Notaro Searched For A Sense Of Humor|url=https://www.npr.org/2015/07/18/423785821/amid-devastation-tig-notaro-searched-for-a-sense-of-humor|accessdate=22 August 2015|work=[[All Things Considered]]|publisher=[[NPR]]|date=18 July 2015}}</ref> which chronicles Notaro's attempts to become pregnant with her fiancée, [[Stephanie Allynne]], was also released.<ref name=Vulture-BoyishGirl-2015>{{cite news|last1=McGlynn|first1=Katla|title=Tig Notaro on Her Documentary Tig, Loving 'the Darkness,' and Why She Wants to Be a Mother|url=http://www.vulture.com/2015/07/tig-notaro-interview-documentary-tig.html|accessdate=17 July 2015|work=[[Vulture (blog)|Vulture]]|publisher=[[New York (magazine)|New York]]|date=17 July 2015}}</ref> The singer [[Sharon Van Etten]] wrote a song in homage to Notaro called "Words" that is shown in the credits.<ref name=ConsequenceSound-Tig-2015>{{cite news|last1=Kayeon|first1=Ben|title=Listen to Sharon Van Etten's "Words", an ode to Tig Notaro|url=http://consequenceofsound.net/2015/07/listen-to-sharon-van-ettens-words-an-ode-to-tig-notaro/|accessdate=17 July 2015|work=[[Consequence of Sound]]|date=14 July 2015}}</ref>
In November 2015, Notaro co-wrote, produced, and starred in a semi-autobiographical [[Television pilot|TV pilot]] for [[Amazon Video]] called ''[[One Mississippi (TV series)|One Mississippi]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title = Watch Tig Notaro's pilot for One Mississippi on Amazon for free|url = http://www.avclub.com/article/watch-tig-notaros-pilot-one-mississippi-amazon-fre-228012|website = www.avclub.com|access-date = 2016-01-26}}</ref> The show received a six-episode series order from Amazon a month later.<ref name=":0">{{cite web|title = Amazon Picks Up 5 New Primetime Series & 3 Kids Series, Renews 'Red Oaks' & 'Hand Of God'|url = http://deadline.com/2015/12/good-girls-revolt-tig-notaro-seires-amazon-red-oaks-hand-of-god-1201667888/|website = Deadline|access-date = 2016-01-26|language = en-US|first = Nellie|last = Andreeva}}</ref> The show follows Notaro's character as she returns to her hometown of Bay Saint Lucille, Mississippi, after her mother's unexpected death.<ref name=":0" />
Her first stand-up one-hour special was released by [[HBO]] in 2015, ''[[Tig Notaro: Boyish Girl Interrupted]]''. In 2016, it was released as her third album on her own label, [[Bentzen Ball#Record Label|Bentzen Ball Records]], which also put out [[Aparna Nancherla]]'s ''Just Putting It Out There''.
In April 2018, it was announced that Notaro would appear in the second season of ''[[Star Trek: Discovery]]'' as Chief Engineer Denise Reno of the U.S.S. Hiawatha.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://variety.com/2018/tv/news/tig-notaro-star-trek-discovery-1202750016/|title=Tig Notaro Joins 'Star Trek: Discovery' Season 2|last=Holloway|first=Daniel|date=2018-04-11|work=Variety|access-date=2018-07-24|language=en-US}}</ref>
[[Netflix]] released Notaro's second one-hour special, ''[[List of original stand-up comedy specials distributed by Netflix|Happy To Be Here]]'', on May 22, 2018.<ref>{{cite web|title=Tig Notaro: Happy To Be Here (2018)|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt8342946/?ref_=ttrel_rel_tt|website=[[IMDb]].com|accessdate=29 April 2018}}</ref>
===Comedic style=== On her approach to comedy (and whether she considers herself a dark comic): "I'm always going to do whatever I think is funniest. If something's dark, I'll do it. If it's a sock puppet, if it's a stool, I'll do it. There's no preconceived idea of who I think I might be now."<ref name=MotherJones-Interview-2013/> Notaro said that since her cancer diagnosis, she has shifted not to darker comedy but rather to personal comedy. Previously she was more distant and [[Observational comedy|observational]], but now she reflects on her childhood and her life.<ref name=LarryKingNow-Interview-2014/>
In the autumn of 2016, she appeared in video as an onstage "stand-in" during the [[Nostalgic for the Present Tour|Nostalgia For the Present]] concert tour of Australian singer [[Sia Furler]] for the song "[[Diamonds (Rihanna song)|Diamonds]]."<ref>{{cite web|last1=Stevenson|first1=Jane|title=Crowd eats up pop star Sia's minimalistic show|url=http://www.torontosun.com/2016/10/23/crowd-eats-up-pop-star-sias-minimalistic-show|website=Torontosun.com|accessdate=6 November 2016}}</ref>
== Personal life == Notaro sometimes discusses her romantic relationships in her act but tries to maintain a level of privacy.<ref name=StarObserver-XenaJoan-2011>{{cite news|last1=Bond|first1=Nick|title=Xena, Joan Jett and me|url=http://www.starobserver.com.au/play/entertainment-play/2011/04/12/xena-joan-jett-and-me/49119|accessdate=December 1, 2014|work=[[Star Observer]]|date=April 12, 2012|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110417202402/http://www.starobserver.com.au/play/entertainment-play/2011/04/12/xena-joan-jett-and-me/49119|archivedate=April 17, 2011}}</ref><ref name=AfterEllen-Personal-2012>{{cite news|last1=Bendix|first1=Trish|title=Tig Notaro gets personal|url=http://www.afterellen.com/general-news/103304-tig-notaro-gets-personal|accessdate=December 1, 2014|work=[[After Ellen]]|date=September 17, 2012}}</ref><ref name=WiscGazzette-LesbianComic-2011>{{cite news|last1=Shapiro|first1=Gregg|title=Lesbian comic Tig Notaro coming to Wisconsin|url=http://www.wisconsingazette.com/interview/lesbian-comic-tig-notaro-coming-to-wisconsin.html|accessdate=December 1, 2014|work=Wisconsin Gazette|date=September 22, 2011|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130209091029/http://www.wisconsingazette.com/interview/lesbian-comic-tig-notaro-coming-to-wisconsin.html|archive-date=February 9, 2013|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}</ref> Notaro met her wife,<ref name=ProfessorBlastoff-LoveLife-2015>{{cite web|last1=Notaro|first1=Tig|title=190 Tig's Love Life Update Stephanie Allynne|url=http://professorblastoff.com/6imte3az291jl3qjpuxllr3rbvkw49/2015/1/190-tigs-journey-with-stephanie-allynne|website=Professor Blastoff|accessdate=January 14, 2015|date=13 January 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20150118011041/http://professorblastoff.com/6imte3az291jl3qjpuxllr3rbvkw49/2015/1/190-tigs-journey-with-stephanie-allynne|archivedate=18 January 2015|df=}}</ref> [[Stephanie Allynne]], on the set of the movie ''[[In a World...]]''<ref name=LarryKingNow-Interview-2014/><ref name=HuffPo-Love-2014>{{cite news|last1=Brekke|first1=Kira|title=Tig Notaro Opens Up About Finding Love: 'She's My Utmost Priority'|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/09/09/tig-notaro-partner_n_5790844.html|accessdate=December 1, 2014|work=[[Huffington Post]]|date=September 9, 2014|format=Video interview}}</ref> They became engaged on January 1, 2015,<ref name=People-Engaged-2015>{{cite news|last1=Schwartz|first1=Alison|title=Tig Notaro Engaged to Stephanie Allynne|url=http://www.people.com/article/tig-notaro-stephanie-allynne-engaged|accessdate=22 August 2015|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=19 January 2015}}</ref> and were married on October 24, 2015.<ref>{{cite news|last=McRady|first=Rachel|title=Exclusive: Tig Notaro Marries Stephanie Allynne, Talks "Wedding Night Sex"|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/tig-notaro-marries-stephanie-allynne-wedding-night-sex-20152710|accessdate=November 1, 2015|work=[[Us Weekly]]|date=October 27, 2015}}</ref> They welcomed twin sons, Max and Finn, on June 26, 2016, conceived using Allynne's eggs via a surrogate.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://celebritybabies.people.com/2016/07/06/tig-notaro-welcomes-twin-sons-max-and-finn/ |title=Tig Notaro Welcomes Twin Boys Max and Finn – Moms & Babies – Celebrity Babies and Kids - Moms & Babies |website=Celebritybabies.people.com |date=2016-06-27 |accessdate=2016-09-26}}</ref>
Notaro plays the guitar and drums and says she is an avid music fan who was in bands when she was younger.<ref name=AskaGrownWoman-2015>{{cite web|last1=Notaro|first1=Tig|title=Ask a Grown Woman: Tig Notaro|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b7L0aPqvkS4|website=Ask a Grown Woman|publisher=[[Rookie (magazine)|Rookie]]|accessdate=17 July 2015|date=9 April 2015}}</ref> "Tig" is a childhood nickname given to her by her brother when she was two years old.<ref name=ComicsComic-2009>{{cite web|url=http://thecomicscomic.typepad.com/thecomicscomic/2009/10/interview-tig-notaro-talks-about-her-showbiz-career-and-curating-the-bentzen-ball-in-dc.html|title=Interview: Tig Notaro talks about her show-biz career, and curating The Bentzen Ball in D.C.|first=Sean L.|last=McCarthy|work=The Comic's Comic|accessdate=September 20, 2012|date=October 19, 2009}}</ref>
=== Cancer === Notaro was diagnosed with [[cancer]] in both breasts on July 30, 2012.<ref name=HuffPo-Cancer-2012>{{cite news| work=[[The Huffington Post]]|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/08/04/tig-notaro-breast-cancer_n_1742071.html|title=Tig Notaro Has Breast Cancer: Comedian Announces Illness On Podcast One Day After Diagnosis|date=August 4, 2012|accessdate=February 23, 2015}}</ref> On August 3, she addressed her recent cancer diagnosis and other personal difficulties during her live stage show at [[Largo (nightclub)|Largo]] in Los Angeles.<ref name=FreshAir-Live-2013>{{cite news|last1=Gross|first1=Terry|last2=Bianculli|first2=David|title=Tig Notaro On Going 'Live' About Her Life|url=https://www.npr.org/2013/07/26/205540155/tig-notaro-on-going-live-about-her-life|accessdate=December 1, 2014|work=[[Fresh Air]]|publisher=NPR.org|date=July 26, 2013|format=Audio interview}}</ref> The set has been described as "instantly legendary," with many comedians praising her work.<ref name=RollingStone-Live-2012>{{cite web|title=Louis C.K. Selling Tig Notaro's Instantly Legendary Comedy Set|work=[[Rolling Stone (magazine)|Rolling Stone]]|date=October 5, 2012|first=Gavin|last=Edwards|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/news/louis-c-k-selling-tig-notaros-instantly-legendary-comedy-set-20121005|accessdate=2012-10-08}}</ref>
The next day, comedian [[Louis C.K.]] called Notaro, telling her he wanted to release the audio of the show.<ref name=LarryKingNow-Interview-2014/> She was uncomfortable with the idea at first but decided the material could help people, so she agreed.<ref name=Makers-Interview/> C.K. made audio of the performance available that October for download on his site under the title ''[[Live (Tig Notaro album)|Live]]''.<ref name=RollingStone-Live-2012/> Notaro later released the audio (with booklet) on [[iTunes Store|iTunes]].<ref name=LouisCK-About-2012>{{cite web|title=About Tig Notaro|url=https://buy.louisck.net/news/about-tig-notaro|website=Louis CK|accessdate=December 1, 2014|date=October 5, 2012}}</ref><ref name=LouisCK-Buy-2913>{{cite web|url=https://buy.louisck.net/help#tig|title=LouisCK.net: FAQ|publisher=Buy.louisck.net|accessdate=March 29, 2013}}</ref> ''Live'' ended up selling more copies than [[Kiss (band)|Kiss']] album ''[[Monster (Kiss album)|Monster]]'', which debuted the same week,<ref name=AVClub-MoreThanKiss-2012>{{cite news|last1=Eakin|first1=Marah|title=People Still Buy Comedy Records: Tig Notaro sells 75,000 copies of Live, is technically more popular than Kiss|url=http://www.avclub.com/article/people-still-buy-comedy-records-tig-notaro-sells-7-86870|accessdate=December 1, 2014|work=[[The A.V. Club]]|date=October 17, 2012}}</ref> something Notaro said she never dreamed could happen. She was a fan of the band in her youth.<ref name=Makers-Interview>{{cite web|title=Tig Notaro: Comedian|url=http://www.makers.com/tig-notaro|format=Video interviews|website=[[Makers: Women Who Make America|Makers]]|accessdate=December 1, 2014}}</ref>
Notaro later had a [[double mastectomy]] with no reconstructive surgery.<ref name=NYTimes-Topless-2014/><ref name=Conan-2012>{{cite interview|last=Notaro|first=Tig|publisher=TBS|location=Burbank, California|title=[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]|interviewer=Conan O'Brien|date=September 20, 2012|accessdate=23 February 2015}}</ref> Notaro opted out of chemo but decided to continue treatment with hormone blocking.<ref name=LarryKingNow-Interview-2014/> After a show in Philadelphia, Notaro was hospitalized<ref name=USAToday-HospitalizationCyst-2014>{{cite news|last1=Puente|first1=Maria|title=Tig Notaro explains medical crisis: A burst cyst|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/people/2014/11/11/tig-notaro-explains-medical-crisis-a-burst-cyst/18850891|accessdate=February 23, 2015|work=[[USA Today]]|date=November 11, 2014}}</ref> and required surgery for a cyst.<ref name=SydneyMorningHerald-Illness-2014>{{cite news|last1=Puvanenthiran|first1=Bhakthi|title=Comedian Tig Notaro cancels Australian tour due to illness|url=http://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/comedy/comedian-tig-notaro-cancels-australian-tour-due-to-illness-20141117-11oc32.html|accessdate=February 23, 2015|work=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|date=November 17, 2014}}</ref>
In November 2014, as part of the New York Comedy Festival, Notaro did a set at [[The Town Hall (New York City)|Town Hall]] in New York City wherein she performed part of the set topless.<ref name=NYTimes-Topless-2014>{{cite news|last1=Zinoman|first1=Jason|title=Going Topless, Tig Notaro Takes Over Town Hall|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/08/arts/going-topless-tig-notaro-takes-over-town-hall.html?_r=0|accessdate=December 1, 2014|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=November 7, 2014}}</ref><ref name=NYorker-Topless-2014>{{cite news|last1=Marantz|first1=Andrew|title=Tig Notaro's Topless Set|url=http://www.newyorker.com/culture/cultural-comment/tig-notaros-topless-set|accessdate=December 1, 2014|work=[[The New Yorker]]|date=November 7, 2014}}</ref> The ''New York Times'' described it: "She showed the audience her scars and then, through the force of her showmanship, made you forget that they were there. It was a powerful, even inspiring, statement about survival and recovery, and yet, it had the larky feel of a dare."<ref name=NYTimes-Topless-2014/>
==Discography== ===Albums=== * 2016: ''[[Tig Notaro: Boyish Girl Interrupted|Boyish Girl Interrupted]]'' ([[Secretly Canadian]]) - CD, LP, Download * 2013: ''[[Live (Tig Notaro album)|Live: Deluxe Edition]]'' (Secretly Canadian) - 2xCD, Picture Disc LP, Download * 2012: ''[[Largo (nightclub)|Live]]'' ([[Pig Newton]]) - Download * 2011: ''[[Good One]]'' (Secretly Canadian) - CD+DVD, LP, Download
===Videos=== * 2014: ''[[The Moth]]'' - "R2 Where Are You" ([[YouTube]])<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dXRsPlhx5ao |title=The Moth Presents Tig Notaro: R2 Where Are You? |publisher=YouTube |date=2014-11-28 |accessdate=2018-01-30}}</ref> - also writer (the audio of the video is the bonus content of her album ''Live: Deluxe Edition'') * 2013: ''[[Professor Blastoff]]'' - 100th Episode! - [[Earwolf]] - Video Podcast Network (YouTube)<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FMz2-c6KnpQ |title=Professor Blastoff - 100th Episode! - Earwolf - Video Podcast Network |publisher=YouTube |date=2013-04-23 |accessdate=2018-06-06}}</ref> * 2008: ''[[Good One|Have Tig at Your Party]]'' - also director, writer, executive producer (bonus DVD of ''Good One: Deluxe Edition'')
===Singles=== * 2017: 7-Inches for [[Planned Parenthood]] ''My Ideal Exchange with a Stranger (Live at [[Largo (nightclub)|Largo]])'' (7-Inches For™, LLC) - 7" pink vinyl, Download * 2016: ''Mississippi Relatives''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://open.spotify.com/album/4oBl3Y0I5WEX1k6vftezTY? |title=Mississippi Relatives by Tig Notaro |publisher=Spotify.com |date=5 August 2016 |accessdate=2018-04-21}}</ref>
===Audiobook=== * 2016: ''I'm Just a Person'' Unabridged ([[Harper Audio]]) - CD {{ISBN|978-1504734523}}, Download {{ASIN|B01EGHBEDE}}
===Compilations=== * 2010: ''Live Nude Comedy, Vol. 1'' (Salient Music) - Download<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/all-the-things-he-decided-not-to-say/736703106?i=736703527 |title=Live Nude Comedy, Vol. 1 by Various Artists on Apple Music |publisher=Itunes.apple.com |date= |accessdate=2018-01-30}}</ref> (tracks 11 and 12) * 2010: ''[[Comedy Death-Ray]] Xmas CD 2010'' ([[ASpecialThing Records]]) - CD<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.discogs.com/Various-Comedy-Death-Ray-Xmas-CD-2010/release/2775673 |title=Various - Comedy Death-Ray Xmas CD 2010 (CD, Album) at Discogs |publisher=Discogs.com |date= |accessdate=2018-01-30}}</ref> (song: ''We Are The World 25.75'')
==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Year ! Title ! ==Audio broadcasts== ===Radio=== * 2012–2016: ''[[This American Life]]'' Episodes 464, 476, 518, 558 and 577<ref>{{cite web|author=00:00 00:00 |url=https://www.thisamericanlife.org/contributors/tig-notaro |title=Archive |publisher=This American Life |date= |accessdate=2018-01-30}}</ref> * June 15, 2016: [[NPR]] ''[[All Things Considered]]''<ref>{{cite web|last=Notaro |first=Tig |url=https://www.npr.org/2016/06/15/482058688/tig-notaro-on-her-terrible-year-in-im-just-a-person |title=Comedian Tig Notaro On Her Terrible Year In 'I'm Just A Person' |publisher=NPR |date=2016-06-15 |accessdate=2018-01-30}}</ref> * July 18, 2015: NPR ''All Things Considered''<ref>{{cite web|author=5:08 PM ET |url=https://www.npr.org/2015/07/18/423785821/amid-devastation-tig-notaro-searched-for-a-sense-of-humor |title=Amid Devastation, Tig Notaro Searched For A Sense Of Humor |publisher=NPR |date=2015-07-18 |accessdate=2018-01-30}}</ref> * July 19, 2013: NPR ''[[Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me!]]'' "Not My Job"<ref>{{cite AV media|url=https://www.npr.org/player/v2/mediaPlayer.html?action=1&t=1&islist=false&id=203609594&m=203626139|title=Comedian Tig Notaro Plays Not My Job|medium=Radio broadcast|work=Wait Wait...Don't Tell Me|date=July 20, 2012|accessdate=February 23, 2015|publisher=[[NPR]]}}</ref><ref name=NPR-Wait-2013>{{cite news|last1=Sagal|first1=Peter|title=Comedian Tig Notaro Plays Not My Job|url=https://www.npr.org/2013/07/20/203609594/comedian-tig-notaro-plays-not-my-job|accessdate=February 23, 2015|work=Wait Wait...Don't Tell Me!|publisher=[[NPR]]|date=December 19, 2013}}</ref> * April 17, 2013: ''[[The Moth]]'' - "R2 Where Are You"<ref>{{cite web|url=https://themoth.org/storytellers/tig-notaro |title=The Art and Craft of Storytelling |publisher=The Moth |date= |accessdate=2018-01-30}}</ref> Recorded December 5, 2012 * December 7, 2012: [[Public Radio International|PRI]] ''[[Science Friday]]''<ref>{{cite web|author=1:00 PM ET |url=https://www.npr.org/2012/12/07/166736402/no-joke |title=No Joke |publisher=NPR |date=2012-12-07 |accessdate=2018-01-30}}</ref> * October 8, 2012: NPR ''[[Fresh Air]]''<ref>{{cite web|author=1:10 PM ET |url=https://www.npr.org/2012/10/08/162514763/standup-comic-tig-notaro |title=Tig Notaro On Going 'Live' About Her Life |publisher=NPR |date=2012-10-08 |accessdate=2018-01-30}}</ref>
